Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2019 09:00AM Jenkins00 wrote: Teja - I had four lymph nodes taken out, two on each side even though the cancer was on one side. Reason being was I chose a double mastectomy so the breast surgeon checked both sides. I did have swelling after which subsided. I don't have lymphedema.
Posts.Title: Sentinel nodes removed on both sides Teja vlnrph

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2019 08:12AM Jenkins00 wrote: I didn't start Teleworking until the third week and even then it was difficult. I had to put pillows under my arms to help with support and I tired easily. First week I was pretty much out of it and there was no way I could work especially with having drains and the medications make you drowsy. Now everyone is different and who is not to say you can't. Good luck!

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2019 11:48AM Jenkins00 wrote: i have my second round of TC tomorrow and water, water, water and walking are key. Meds are important especially at the first sign of nausea. Don’t wait. This was stressed to me by the nurses and my MO. Protein is also important. Any issues let your MO know they hve an arsenal of meds to help with SE’s. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Starting TC chemo next week and need advice on meds OneKT OneKT

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2019 10:32AM Jenkins00 wrote: The number of chemo treatments depends on the diagnosis or if a MammaPrint or Oncotype was completed and came back high risk for reoccurence. I am having four rounds because my MammaPrint came back high risk for reoccurrence even though I was diagnosed Stage 1 with no lymph node involvement.

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2019 12:32PM Jenkins00 wrote: My MO started me on D3 and Calcium Carbonate before treatment then added B6 during treatment. My calcium levels were low prior and this was the first time it was checked.
Posts.Title: Vitamin D3 supplementation during chemotherapy? Kkmay nanette7fl

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2019 05:43PM Jenkins00 wrote: Just found this thread! I was classified as Stage I after my BMX surgery. Starting chemo next Monday as my MammaPrint came back high risk, Luminal B. I've had issues since I was 13 when I first got my menstrual cycle. On the pill for 10 years until I got pregnant with my son. This was pure luck as I got pregnant right after I stopped taking the pill. I could never get pregnant after, my cycle was just so messed up, even tried AI. Only to discover I had endometriosis which resulted in a hysterectomy with only my right ovary remaining. On top of this I was dealing with nipple discharge on and off for 18 years that was a result from a microadema on my pituitary gland. Test after test it felt like for female issues. Now, BC. Whatever will be, will be!

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2019 09:37AM Jenkins00 wrote: justme1964 - Its hard not to be stressed and wanting to find out as much information. I did the same but learned it will not help. I have all of my reports which I looked at once then put it away. I think once you have a plan in place it will get better. Getting second opinions do help. I talked with my husband's oncologist while at an appointment and he reassured me. You will get through this. We are here for you.

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2019 09:28AM Jenkins00 wrote: Oil diffuser with lavender or CBD oil which does not have THC in it. I use both to help with sleep. I also have a relax meditation app on my phone.
Posts.Title: Need some advice with sleeping, anxiety, etc kec1972 lyzzysmom

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2019 10:14AM Jenkins00 wrote: Hi Ya'll! I am from the January board and will finish my fourth round March 18th. I just wanted to pop in here and say for those who are starting you will get through this!!! You will have good days and bad days. If you get offers of help take it! You will learn to let things go. Most important advice is listen to your body. Rest when needed and drink, drink, drink! For me when it became real was when I sat in the chair for the first time. However, I was calm. I wasn't scared or nervous. I listened to the nurse and asked a ton of questions. Good luck and take care!!
Posts.Title: Chemo starting March 2019 Fallschurchgirl Laurencl

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2019 06:27PM Jenkins00 wrote: Hello! I’m from the January group and for constipation I use Phillips Milk of Magnesia. Seems to be the best for me as I tried Miralax, Senakot and Ducolax with no success. I also eat prunes and put dried apricots in my oatmeal or cream of wheat. Water is important too. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Chemo starting March 2019 Fallschurchgirl Laurencl

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2019 10:51AM Jenkins00 wrote: solobroker - I only take the Milk of Magnesia at night and only if I haven't had a bowel movement by day three. I've only had to do this twice during chemo. It didn't cause the opposite effect for me. I couldn't do the fasting so I really focused on eating healthy, nothing greasy, heavy, or fatty.
